moves.title: Side Special (Waddle/Gordo Toss)
changes: A Gordo dropped while being interrupted from Side Special will now do the normal 18% rather than 25%

moves.title: Other
changes: Fixed issue where Nana could receive analog inputs (shields, L-cancels, etc) outside of her normal control range

moves.title: Neutral Special (Eruption)
changes: Both aerial and grounded versions now gain armor every 30 frames of charging; 0 > 20 > 40 > 80 > 120 > Super; this change was intended for 3.0, but missed in the game files

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: Strong upsmash BKB 80 > 70; this change was intended for 3.0, but missed in the game files

moves.title: Up Special (Spring)
changes: Black special fall flash now occurs when Up Special is no longer actionable
Up Special now uses its own ledge grab box that was previously unused; this new LGB is higher by 0.5 units

moves.title: Down Special (Spin Dash)
changes: Now has hitboxes during the charge animation (identical to Sonic); this change was intended for 3.0, but missed in the game files
Down Special resource now refreshes out of all grounded ledge actions tech animation slideoffs

moves.title: Down Special (Luigi Tornado)
changes: Re-added the foot hitbox of aerial version, as it was accidently deleted from PM 3.02 > 3.5

moves.title: Other
changes: Pikmin are now always intangible on frame 1 of aerial attacks; this change was intended for 3.0, but missed in the game files
Fixed Pikmin in aerial attacks losing intangibility if moved too far from the starting position when the attack started
Olimar will no longer try to use “busy” Pikmin when attacking, which caused his animation to play with no hitbox present

moves.title: Other
changes: Upwards facing missed tech get up attack invincibility corrected to match active frames

moves.title: Up Special (Spring)
changes: Black special fall flash now occurs when Up Special is no longer actionable
Up Special now uses its own ledge grab box that was previously unused; this new LGB is higher by 0.5 units
Fixed bug where only using aerials would provide intended drift during Up Special; this change was intended for 3.0, but missed in the game files

moves.title: Side Special (Spin Manuevers)
changes: Side Special resource now refreshes out of all grounded ledge actions tech animation slideoffs

moves.title: Down Special (Spin Dash)
changes: Down Special resource will now be restored out of the grounded charge cancel animation
Down Special resource now refreshes out of all grounded ledge actions tech animation slideoffs

moves.title: Side Special (Egg Roll)
changes: Fixed issue where Yoshi could warp to the ledge during the endlag of Side Special
Aerial Side Special resource will no longer be considered consumed if Yoshi is hit out of Side Special on the ground

moves.title: Every hidden stage alt has now been moved to be an L+Start or R+Start stage with the exception of Smashville’s concert stages to allow for visual confirmation before selecting a stage. Additionally helps to confirm 1:1 stages that were previously only hidden alts. File sizes of moved or updated stages may be lower due to small stage optimizations recently discovered

changes.title: (L+Start alt) Duel Zone
changes: Moved from hidden Y alt

changes.title: Default
changes: Side platforms moved down by one unit
Middle platform lowered by two units
All platform models Y scale reduced (1 > 0.7)
All platform model X size reduced (30 > 28.5)
Changes ported to all BC 1:1s
Fixed eye glow on the fountainhead

changes.title: (R+Start alt) Dry Bowser’s Castle (NEW!)
changes: New alternate stage featuring blue lava and Dry Bowser decorations

moves.title: Characters and Gameplay
changes: All Delfino’s Secret alts adjusted slightly to prevent clipping through the stage when the center platform is lowered
Fixed the right ledge on Bell Tower not being grabbable in certain circumstances
The camera in Stamina mode will no longer focus on KO’d bodies temporarily after they are defeated
Player tags will remain onscreen when a Double Cherry clone player dies but the primary character remains alive

moves.title: Costumes
changes: Fixed eye animation and blinking issues on Turbo Charged Donkey Kong
Fixed color tint on Sega Kid Sonic’s eyelids, default costume has a texture fix for the back of his shoe
Racing Suit Sonic final smash eyes fixed
Super ZSS now has correct eye textures
Justin Bailey console eyes are green as originally intended
Kirby’s hidden R costume DK hat now fixed

moves.title: Other
changes: Fixed an oversight where War Mode when combined with Super Sudden Death or Wild Mode would cause lag at match start
Items will no longer spawn on match start for Very High and Intense item selection
When selecting music on a hidden stage alt, the selection will no longer be wiped out
Fixed win quote not playing for when Sonic wins a match vs. Knuckles
Fixed Dragoon always spawning when items set to low
ItemEX fixes relating to Subspace and Enemy Items, and overriding Subspace sound banks
Fixed issue where CPU opponents couldn’t hit each other during title screen demos
Fixed a niche issue with Wii Remotes crashing on the netplay build; this issue was previously patched on console builds shortly after 3.0.2’s release

moves.title: Costumes
changes: All Roy costumes have further face optimizations, default Roy’s inner cape textures no longer have reduced texture size, cape colors are unchanged
Doctor Mario’s pills now use color animations to randomize pill variants
Vacation Mario has improved rigging
Team Rocket Pikachu default tails match renders
Mario and ZSS clear models updated and optimized
Snake’s hidden costume have had their facial optimizations ported from the default costumes
Kirby’s animation when using Ganon’s copy ability no longer bends his foot

moves.title: Other
changes: Double Cherry clones will now remain alive during star/screen KOs (a-la Nana)
Small update to strap screen models and title screen animation
Updated version number to v3.0.5 build-wide
